intro: Crotalaria dissitiflora var. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered crotalaria, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a herbaceous annual plant characterized by its erect growth habit and alternate leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. The flowers are typically yellow with a distinctive black or purple spot at the base of the petals, and they are arranged in racemose inflorescences. This plant belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and has the ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen through symbiotic relationships with rhizobia. Its ornamental value is often appreciated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
